For example, the tokenization of the number 11222113 equals 1213. Write a function tokenize :: Int -> Int that given a nonnegative integer n as input computes its tokenization as deﬁned above. Examples: tokenize 0 = 0 tokenize 1 = 1 tokenize 11 = 1 tokenize 11222113 = 1213 Solution: tokenize :: Int -> Int tokenize n | n < 10 = n | d’ == d = n’ | otherwise = 10 * n’ + d where n’ = tokenize (n ‘div‘ 10) d = n ‘mod‘ 10 d’ = n’ ‘mod‘ 10
